intro: Diplusodon incanus, commonly known as the hairy antelope. It is a flowering plant native to southern Africa, characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, pale green leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Diplusodon incanus is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
